releases.title: v1.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • httptesting: fix for Go 1.6 by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/93
  • testing: remove deprecated AddSuiteCleanup function by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/94
  • add PatchExecHelper and CaptureOutput helpers by @natefinch in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/95
  • Fix PatchExecHelper.GetExecCommand on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/96
  • Handle the error return from utils.SetHome(). by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/97
  • testing: add TCPProxy.CloseConns by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/98
  • mgo: don’t panic while resetting admin password by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/99
  • Don’t drop and recreate the database between tests by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/100
  • testing: don’t panic during TearDownTest if SetUpTest failed by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/101
  • Added BSONEquals checker by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/103
  • Detect mongod version before starting test server by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/104
  • lp:1596045 handle CRLF in mongo version line by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/105
  • copy clock from juju/juju/testing by @jrwren in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/106
  • Update to use the latest loggo. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/107
  • Retry mgo dial if unexpected message. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/109
  • Hook up mgo logging and reconnect properly. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/110
  • add NewProxiedSession by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/111
  • implement Clock.NewTimer by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/108
  • Bump mongo error output to 100 lines by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/112
  • Update testing.Clock to improve robustness by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/113
  • NewProxiedSession - ping to assign a socket to the returned session. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/114
  • checkers: ignore time zone in DeepEqual by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/115
  • MongoDB needs –key=value not –key value now by @dooferlad in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/116
  • Fixes for replicaset by @macgreagoir in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/117
  • Introduces a type which can be used to mock calls by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/118
  • tcpproxy: add pause and resume to the stream by @mhilton in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/119
  • Disable mgo logging/debugging by default by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/120
  • Mongo 3.4 uses a different string to indicate it is ready for connections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/121
  • Fix EchoQuotedArgsUnix/AssertEchoArgs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/122
  • Fix PatchExecutableAsEchoArgs on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/124
  • Prefer mongod 3.2 and improve mongod info caching by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/123
  • Default mongo storage backend to mmapv1 by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/126
  • Add MgoInstance.SSLEnabled method by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/125
  • Remove deprecated –sslOnNormalPorts arg to mongod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/127
  • Fix typo in mongo command by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/128
  • Stub check calls without order. by @anastasiamac in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/132
  • testing: default to mmapv1 only on x86(_64) by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/133
  • Don’t try to truncate the local replicaset oplog. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/135
  • Changes to support Mongo 3.6. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/136
  • Expose the version of Mongo that we are testing against. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/137
  • enable vendor as the highest priority import path by @ycliuhw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/138
  • Add short and long timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/139
  • Use juju/clock by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/140
  • Add the location of mongod in bionic to the list of places we look. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/141
  • Enable Mongo with Replica Sets by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/142
  • If using Replicaset use wiredTiger. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/143
  • Add support for finding the juju-db snap when looking for mongod by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/144
  • Allow testing of DoRequest against status code by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/145
  • Malformed errors by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/146
  • Fix address already in use detection. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/147
  • Move to go mod + fix juju-db snap usage by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/148
  • Fix issue with juju suites overwriting HOME by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/149
  • Sidestep HOME env var for juju-db snap testing by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/150
  • Add multi-checker by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/151
  • Add go style expressions for multichecker matching. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/152
  • Upgrade juju/utils package to v2 by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/153
  • Fix performance issue with using collstats. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/154
  • Only use mmapv1 args for mmap storage engine by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/155
  • Only use maxTransactionLockRequestTimeoutMillis for mongo 4 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/156
  • Update to use juju/mgo/v2 repo by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/158
  • Ensure that the namespaced collections in the logs db are removed during teardown. by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/160
  • Allow suites that depend on MgoSuite to disable cleanup. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/162
  • Update to use utils/v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/163
  • Upstream dep updates by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/164

New Contributors

  • @natefinch made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/95
  • @babbageclunk made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/100
  • @kat-co made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/103
  • @reedobrien made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/112
  • @alesstimec made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/114
  • @macgreagoir made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/117
  • @mjs made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/123
  • @anastasiamac made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/132
  • @ycliuhw made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/138
  • @timClicks made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/144
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/145
  • @hpidcock made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/147
  • @achilleasa made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/160

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/testing/commits/v1.0.0

releases.title: v0.6.0
releases.body:
NOTES:

  • The Juju API is upgraded to 2.9.42

FEATURES:

  • New resource: juju_machine enable users to provision machines using juju. (Thanks @jadonn)
  • New data source: juju_machine enable users to incorporate already provisioned machines to their plans. (Thanks @gboutry)

ENHANCEMENTS:

  • Applications now have a placement directive to indicate target machines.

BUG FIXES:

  • Fixed parsing problem with ED25519 ssh keys. (Thanks @jsimpso)
  • Fixed wrong application import due to inconsistent order of elements in application placement

What’s Changed

  • Add support for Placement directives in applications and add a new Machine resource by @jadonn in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/152
  • chore(deps): bump github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-docs from 0.13.0 to 0.14.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/166
  • Update juju client to version 2.9.42 by @juanmanuel-tirado in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/167
  • Add a Machine Resource (basic support for juju add-machine) by @jadonn in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/165
  • Update ssh_key import example by @jsimpso in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/172
  • Update SSH key parsing by @jsimpso in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/174
  • [JUJU-3280] Sort placement directive to ensure fair comparisons. by @juanmanuel-tirado in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/175
  • Add machine data source by @gboutry in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/170
  • chore(deps): bump actions/setup-go from 3 to 4 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/176
  • [JUJU-3286] Update changelog for v0.6.0 release. by @juanmanuel-tirado in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/178

New Contributors

  • @jadonn made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/152
  • @gboutry made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/170

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/compare/v0.5.0…v0.6.0

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Expose PruneTxns in order to allow external tools to use it by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/16
  • Add progress logging while pruning transactions by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/17
  • Retry errors that finish with ‘unexpected message’. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • Add export_test.go by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/19
  • Use mgo.Collection.Bulk to prune docs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/20
  • Add RunTransaction observer by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/21
  • Use disk-based pruning strategy by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/22
  • Make prune log output consistent by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/23
  • Cleanup txn.Stash as part of regular pruning by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • Cleanup all collections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/25
  • Don’t create transactions that have no operations. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/27
  • Abstract out “Completed Transaction” functionality by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/26
  • Properly test no-op does the right thing, as does real errors. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/28
  • Add a command-line utility to clean and purge txns. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • Add logging information about the pruning result. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/29
  • Turns out it isn’t safe to use aggregation in 2.4 at all. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/31
  • support using RemoveAll($in) instead of Bulk. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/32
  • Various cleanups by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/35
  • track what is actually removed by Oracle.RemoveTxns() by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/34
  • Expose a NewestTime for PruneOptions. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/36
  • Handle Bulk.Run() result being nil by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/37
  • When observing transactions include the run Duration. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/40
  • Change Clock back to being optional. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/41
  • Allow passing in a parameter to limit the number of transactions evaluated by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/42
  • Expose the batch size and number of batches. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/43
  • No need for uint64 and it makes default printing ugly by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/44
  • Use juju/clock package for the clock. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/45
  • Incremental prune by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/46
  • 2.4 prune options by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/47
  • Pass the transaction attempt by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • Revert “Merge pull request #48 from SimonRichardson/txn-attempt” by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/51

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Fix all the license headers. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/11
  • Controller interface by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/12
  • Add Spaces and Subnets. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/14
  • Add BootResource, Fabric, VLAN by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/13
  • Controller.AllocateMachine by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/15
  • Filter machines by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/16
  • Add ReleaseMachines method to the Controller. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/17
  • Validate credentials during NewController. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/19
  • Add the method to start machines by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/18
  • Devices by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/20
  • Create a device by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/21
  • Add types for interface and links. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/22
  • Add, list, read and delete files. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/23
  • More networky fields by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/25
  • Expose tags for interfaces and machines. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/24
  • Return the optional IPAddress for a Link. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/27
  • Add CreatePhysicalInterface to Device. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/26
  • Allocate machine with interface and storage constraints by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/28
  • Delete interfaces by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/29
  • Expose the interfaces of a device. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/31
  • Devices query can specify more than one hostname. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/30
  • Rework allocate machine… again. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/32
  • Fix Device.InterfaceSet to not return an error. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/34
  • Link and Unlink Subnet to an interface by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/33
  • Devices for a Machine. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/36
  • Update interface name, mac address, or vlan. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/35
  • Remove create op name. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/37
  • Create device for machine by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/38
  • Machine.Start should not base64 encode the userdata by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/39
  • Parse and return BlockDevices for Machines. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/40
  • Add ConstraintMatches.Storage by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/41
  • VLAN name is optional in 2.0 API schema by @dimitern in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/42
  • Use uint64 for blockdevice and partition sizes. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/43
  • Make dns_servers optional in subnets by @voidspace in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/44
  • Don’t return typed nil interface values by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/46
  • Use the correct VLAN in machine.CreateDevice by @voidspace in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/47
  • Make kflavor optional by @voidspace in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/49
  • Handle nils in filesystem by @voidspace in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/50
  • Make MAAS2 constraint matches lists by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/51
  • Make model optional in blockdevice schema by @voidspace in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/52
  • Update for more potential nils. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/53
  • MAAS2: handle fields that might be missing or null from the API by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/54
  • Add device methods to TestService by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/55
  • Enable test devices to have multiple MAC addresses by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/56
  • Enable reading and setting machine owner data by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/57
  • Fix typo in operation name by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/58
  • Machine.CreateDevice() - added VLAN to args; only use args.Subnet/VLAN if set by @dimitern in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/59
  • Forgot to push @thumper’s suggested fixes :( by @dimitern in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/60
  • machine: Fix panic if primary device NIC’s VLAN is nil by @dimitern in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/61
  • Switch from using not_networks to not_subnets by @voidspace in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/62
  • Expose the StaticRoutes API by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/63
  • Added functions related to tags in testservice by @YujiOshima in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/64
  • controller: Accept a versioned API URL by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/65
  • Make SplitVersionedURL public by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/66
  • Don’t return UnsupportedVersionError for unexpected errors from version check by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/67
  • Work around MAAS 1.9.4 bug by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/68
  • Expose block device id_path attribute by @axw in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/69
  • Add as a potential placement directive constraint. by @ExternalReality in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/70
  • Fix allow storage constraints to search both physical and virtual(logi by @ExternalReality in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/71
  • Update deps. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/73
  • Add ‘domains’ endpoint request. by @ExternalReality in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/74
  • Add ability to handle partition match with the machine allocation constraint map response. by @blakerouse in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/75
  • Implement pools by @notjames in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/79
  • Allow devices without pools to be properly parsed by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/81
  • Allow machines without pools to be properly parsed. by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/82
  • Add Domain to CreateMachineDeviceArgs by @stgraber in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/86
  • Enable go mod and switch to juju/mgo package by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/88
  • Use v1 suffix for imports and module name by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/89
  • Update go.mod to require at least go 1.14 by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/90
  • Bump go mod version to v2 by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/92
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/94
  • [JUJU-593] Add APIVersionInfo to the controller by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/95
  • Allow configuration of underlying HTTP client. by @markylaing in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/97
  • Adds support for listing tags, filtering machines by tag, and getting machine hardware info by @markylaing in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/96

New Contributors

  • @howbazaar made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/11

releases.title: juju-restore v0.13
releases.body: Add support for cloning secret backends to the --copy-controller option. See #24 .

releases.title: juju-restore v0.12
releases.body: Add a new --copy-controller option to initialise a new controller to look like a backed up controller. This is useful when setting up a controller for a newer Juju version and copying to that new controller users, clouds, and config from an existing controller. See #23.

releases.title: 2.5.1: Fix str vs bytes issue with testing push()
releases.body: This is a patch fix on top of 2.5.0 to fix #990: “TypeError: write() argument must be str, not bytes” in Container.push under Harness.

releases.title: 2.5.0: Harness.get_filesystem_root, Pebble service context, and more
releases.body:
This release includes three significant additions:

  1. Multi-status: An initial version of the much-discussed “multi-status” handling in the form of the new collect_app_status and collect_unit_status events. This is useful for letting the framework automatically evaluate application (or unit) status from various components of the charm. We’ll be documenting this properly soon, but in the meantime, read the API reference docs on CollectStatusEvent. PR #954.
  2. Harness.get_filesystem_root: Overhauling the Harness’s test filesystem from an in-memory filesystem to use a temp directory on the real filesystem; use Harness.get_filesystem_root to get the temp filesystem directory for a specific container. This makes testing container filesystem operations significantly easier and allows tests to use the regular Python file APIs to interact with it. Thanks @weiiwang01 for his efforts on this in #960.
  3. Service context: Added support for Pebble’s new “service context” feature, to allow you to exec commands in the context of a specified service (where context means environment variables, working directory, and user/group). PR #957.

Other notable changes:

  • Add JujuVersion.supports_open_port_on_k8s by @carlcsaposs-canonical in PR #965
  • Support reading charmcraft.yaml in the testing harness by @syu-w in PR #977

In addition, the following developers made their first contribution:

  • @paulomach in #975 (Add kill-delay to pebble ServiceDict type)
  • @sobolevn in #978 (Replace typing.AnyStr with Union[str, bytes])
  • @syu-w in #977 (Support reading charmcraft.yaml in testing harness)

We also made several other minor improvements to type annotations and a few other tweaks. See the full changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.4.1…2.5.0

releases.title: 2.4.1: Add type annotation for PebbleReadyEvent.workload
releases.body:
This is a patch release: a minor but important type annotation forgotten in 2.4.0. Without it, charms that use type annotation on the pebble-ready events will fail type checking, because attributes of the workload won’t be available as Pyright/MyPy doesn’t know the type.

Fix in #962.

commits.author: Jason Nucciarone
commits.message:
Enable systemd service methods to accept multiple args (#106)

Extended the service methods to accept multiple args so
that charm authors do not need to directly call the
private `_systemctl` method.

For example, now the option `--no-block` can be passed
to the start command for services that take several
seconds to fully start up.

---------

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone <jason.nucciarone@canonical.com>
Co-authored-by: Ben Hoyt <ben.hoyt@canonical.com>

releases.title: v0.6.0 - Protecting Community Contributions
releases.body:
Added

  • Raising PRs with community contributions on discourse
  • Signing commits if required by a repository

Changed

  • Conflict detection logic no longer uses git to merge for page conflicts. Instead any differences between discourse and the feature branch on a specific page lead to a failed run.

Fixed

  • Improved logging of conflicts

releases.title: v0.5.0 Remove base_branch Input
releases.body:
Changed

  • Removed base_branch input.

Fixed

  • Add support for handling tags that are directly linked to a commit which resulted in a failure before.

releases.title: v0.4.0 Use Tag to Track Latest Content
releases.body:
Changed

  • The base for the content comparison is no longer based on using a branch. Instead, the action will look for a tag with a default value of upload-charm-docs/base-content which can be changed using the base_tag_name input. This ensures that the comparison can be made even if the action is run on the default branch. The action will now fail if the base_tag_name is not found on the repository.
  • On a successful run in reconciliation mode with dry run not enabled, the action will automatically add the base_tag_name tag to the commit on which it was run.
  • The base_branch input has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. It is no longer in use.

commits.author: Ashley James
commits.message:
Add new redfish metrics (#36)

Adds these new metrics from redfish.

* redfish_processors: total number of processors
* redfish_processor_info: processor info
* redfish_storage_controllers: total number of storage controllers
* redfish_storage_controller_info: storage controller info
* redfish_network_adapters: total number of network adapters
* redfish_chassis_info: chassis info
* redfish_storage_drives: total number of drives
* redfish_storage_drive_info: storage drive info
* redfish_memory_dimms: total number of memory dimms
* redfish_memory_dimm_info: memory dimm info
* redfish_smart_storage_health: health of smart storage

These metrics are added to obtain either the count of a particular resource or for health,state etc. info from the <metric>_info metric.

RedfishHelper is now implemented as a context manager. It opens up a new redfish session while entering and logs out at exit.
RedfishHelper's discover method is now a staticmethod.
